Dating: NAQADA II (not before); NAQADA III (not after)
Name: Stone receptacle
Description: Like the calcite vase E.3359, this example of diorite comes from tomb 142  of the cemetery of El-Gerza excavated in 1910-1911 by the english archaeologist G.A Wainwright. It served as a container for oils and perfume unguents.
